payable","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"startTime","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalClaimed","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"transferTokenMode","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_recipient","type":"address"}],"name":"triggerCutoff","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"distributionFound","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"| This contract manages the distribution contracts for the Shyft Network. It is built to enable a native-mode or erc20-mode distribution with specific distribution tables (with individual cycles with %'s and times). | For each of the individuals allocated to, they have their own (potentially unique) distribution table, along with a potential cutoff (reduction) & the address which is managing that, as well as total distributed and any cliff/vesting information.","events":{"EVT_cutoffTriggered(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Event for cutoff being triggered."},"EVT_cutoffTriggeredOverAllocated(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Event for cutoff being triggered (for the \"over allocated\" case where a user has already withdrawn more tokens than would have been available post-cutoff)."},"EVT_newAllocation(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,bytes32)":{"details":"Event for new allocation created."},"EVT_shyftClaimed(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Event for new shyft total claimed. created."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"claimTokens(address)":{"details":"Allows a user to claim their allocated tokens. *Any* address can perform the claim on *any* recipient for the purposes of abstracting the gas cost for those recipients (ie an external party can pay for the gas of the claim function, for their client).","params":{"_recipient":"The address of the recipient."},"returns":{"result":"   | (any number) = (success) the number of tokens that have been claimed    | 3 = (error) already claimed all available tokens from entire vesting period    | 2 = (error) block timestamp is lower than cliff    | 1 = (error) already claimed all tokens possible thus far (requires more time to pass)    | 0 = (error) could not get tokens allocated","success":"   | true = claimed tokens successfully    | false = error in sending, or preconditions not met (see \"result\")","timeStamp":"the current block timestamp"}},"constructor":{"details":"Constructor function - Sets the start time and token transfer mode. False equates to native, True equates to erc20 token transfer mode.","params":{"_startTime":"The time when ShyftDistribution goes live","_transferTokenMode":"Whether this contract transfers tokens from the primary shyft kyc contract in the registry."}},"disableSettingNewAllocations()":{"details":"Disables the ability of the Owner (initial deployer) of this contract to set any new allocations. The call can only be completed correctly by the Owner.","returns":{"result":"   | true = completed disabling new allocations    | false = not owner"}},"getCurrentCycleNumber(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gets the current cycle number for the recipient at the specified distribution time.","params":{"_currentDistributionTime":"The distribution time to calculate the cycle with.","_recipient":"The address of the recipient."},"returns":{"curCycle":"the current distribution cycle for this recipient at the specified distribution time."}},"getTokensAvailable(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gets the tokens available to be claimed for this recipient.","params":{"_recipient":"The address of the recipient.","_referenceTime":"The reference time for the calculation."},"returns":{"currentCycleNumber":"the current distribution cycle number for this recipient","result":"   | 3 = got tokens claimed    | 2 = already claimed all tokens possible thus far (requires more time to pass)    | 1 = already claimed all tokens possible    | 0 = block timestamp invalid","tokensReceived":"the amount of tokens received (total tokens - previously claimed)","tokensTransferred":"the amount of tokens transferred (in total, including previously claimed tokens)"}},"setAllocation(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,bytes32)":{"details":"Sets the allocation for a specific recipient with cliff, vest, potential reduction if cutoff is triggered, and the distribution table hash. Also blocks recipients from being added twice (referencing the distribution table hash) as an additional precautionary measure.","params":{"_cutoffAdminAddress":"The address of the actor responsible for performing the cutoff (reduction) of the token allocation.","_cutoffTokenAmount":"The amount of tokens that can be reduced from this allocation if triggered by the cutoff address.","_distributionTableHash":"The hash of the distribution table that this allocation follows.","_endCliffDays":"The end of the cliff (in days).","_endVestingDays":"The end of the vesting (in days).","_recipient":"The address of the recipient.","_totalAllocated":"The total tokens allocated."},"returns":{"result":"should be \"1\" if all is processed successfully."}},"setKycContractRegistryAddress(address)":{"details":"Sets the KYC contract registry address so that (in the case where this is a token vs native fuel distribution) the claim process can correctly identify the contract it is distributing to.","params":{"_address":"The address of the KYC contract registry."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = set registry contract successfully    | false = has already been set, or not the owner"}},"setShyftCoreTokenAddress(address)":{"details":"Sets the Shyft Core token address so that any cutoff tokens are properly allocated back to a Shyft Core wallet.","params":{"_address":"The address of the Shyft Core token address."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = set shyft core token address successfully    | false = has already been set, or not the owner"}},"setupDistributionTable(string,uint256,(uint256,uint256,uint256,int128)[],uint256[])":{"details":"Sets up a new distribution table with cycles and the total percentages of each cycle.","params":{"_cycles":"An array of \"distributionCycle\"-formatted cycles.","_distributionTableName":"The name of this distribution table.","_totalPercentAtEndOfCycles_18DecimalPrecision":"An array of the total percentage of distribution at the end of the cycles (cumulative).","_vestEndSeconds":"When the vest ends in seconds."},"returns":{"result":"   | [uint256] = (success) distribution table keccak hash for further reference (in uint256 format)    | 9 = (error) time period does not start immediately    | 8 = (error) time period didn't start as the previous ended    | 7 = (error) time period is higher than full vesting days    | 6 = (error) time period does not end on the full vesting day    | 5 = (error) allocation cycle does not equal 100%    | 4 = (error) allocation cycle If there are any tokens remaining from the distribution (total-cutoff) those are returned to the Shyft Core pool.      | The algorithm is: \"remaining = (total - cutoff) - withdrawn\", as long as \"withdrawn\" is lower than the newly cutoff allocation, otherwise it'll return how many tokens are over-allocated.","params":{"_recipient":"The address of the recipient."},"returns":{"distributionFound":"if triggered, will return the remaining distribution","result":"   | 3 = set the cutoff for this recipient, still has distribution    | 2 = set the cutoff for this recipient, was over already over-allocated    | 1 = cutoff already triggered    | 0 = not the cutoff admin address designated for this recipient"}}},"stateVariables":{"INITIAL_SUPPLY":{"details":"The initial supply. will revert() if there is an error in the sending/claiming process."}},"notice":"|  This function should be disabled before launch, but for testing purposes there is a requirement to be able to receive native fuel, so this is done in the most strict mode possible, by checking ownership before value transfer can occur. |  receive() external payable { |      if (msg.sender != owner) { | whenever any \"test\" related Grunt command is devdoc.details: | This contract manages the distribution contracts for the Shyft Network. It is built to enable a native-mode or erc20-mode distribution with specific distribution tables (with individual cycles with %'s and times). | For each of the individuals allocated to, they have their own (potentially unique) distribution table, along with a potential cutoff (reduction) & the address which is managing that, as well as total distributed and any cliff/vesting information.

EVT_cutoffTriggeredOverAllocated(address.details: Event for cutoff being triggered (for the "over allocated" case where a user has already withdrawn more tokens than would have been available post-cutoff).

EVT_shyftClaimed(address,uint256,uint256.details: Event for new shyft total claimed. created.

claimTokens(address).details: Allows a user to claim their allocated tokens. *Any* address can perform the claim on *any* recipient for the purposes of abstracting the gas cost for those recipients (ie an external party can pay for the gas of the claim function, for their client).

returns.result: | (any number) = (success) the number of tokens that have been claimed    | 3 = (error) already claimed all available tokens from entire vesting period    | 2 = (error) block timestamp is lower than cliff    | 1 = (error) already claimed all tokens possible thus far (requires more time to pass)    | 0 = (error) could not get tokens allocated
returns.success: | true = claimed tokens successfully    | false = error in sending, or preconditions not met (see "result")

constructor.details: Constructor function - Sets the start time and token transfer mode. False equates to native, True equates to erc20 token transfer mode.

params._startTime: The time when ShyftDistribution goes live
params._transferTokenMode: Whether this contract transfers tokens from the primary shyft kyc contract in the registry.

disableSettingNewAllocations().details: Disables the ability of the Owner (initial deployer) of this contract to set any new allocations. The call can only be completed correctly by the Owner.

returns.result: | true = completed disabling new allocations    | false = not owner

getCurrentCycleNumber(address,uint256).details: Gets the current cycle number for the recipient at the specified distribution time.

params._currentDistributionTime: The distribution time to calculate the cycle with.

returns.curCycle: the current distribution cycle for this recipient at the specified distribution time.

getTokensAvailable(address,uint256).details: Gets the tokens available to be claimed for this recipient.

params._referenceTime: The reference time for the calculation.

returns.currentCycleNumber: the current distribution cycle number for this recipient
returns.result: | 3 = got tokens claimed    | 2 = already claimed all tokens possible thus far (requires more time to pass)    | 1 = already claimed all tokens possible    | 0 = block timestamp invalid
returns.tokensReceived: the amount of tokens received (total tokens - previously claimed)
returns.tokensTransferred: the amount of tokens transferred (in total, including previously claimed tokens)

setAllocation(address,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Sets the allocation for a specific recipient with cliff, vest, potential reduction if cutoff is triggered, and the distribution table hash. Also blocks recipients from being added twice (referencing the distribution table hash) as an additional precautionary measure.

params._cutoffAdminAddress: The address of the actor responsible for performing the cutoff (reduction) of the token allocation.
params._cutoffTokenAmount: The amount of tokens that can be reduced from this allocation if triggered by the cutoff address.
params._distributionTableHash: The hash of the distribution table that this allocation follows.
params._endCliffDays: The end of the cliff (in days).
params._endVestingDays: The end of the vesting (in days).

returns.result: should be "1" if all is processed successfully.

setKycContractRegistryAddress(address).details: Sets the KYC contract registry address so that (in the case where this is a token vs native fuel distribution) the claim process can correctly identify the contract it is distributing to.

params._address: The address of the KYC contract registry.

returns.result: | true = set registry contract successfully    | false = has already been set, or not the owner

setShyftCoreTokenAddress(address).details: Sets the Shyft Core token address so that any cutoff tokens are properly allocated back to a Shyft Core wallet.

params._address: The address of the Shyft Core token address.

returns.result: | true = set shyft core token address successfully    | false = has already been set, or not the owner

setupDistributionTable(string,uint256,(u.details: Sets up a new distribution table with cycles and the total percentages of each cycle.

params._distributionTableName: The name of this distribution table.
params._totalPercentAtEndOfCycles_18DecimalPrec: An array of the total percentage of distribution at the end of the cycles (cumulative).
params._vestEndSeconds: When the vest ends in seconds.

returns.result: | [uint256] = (success) distribution table keccak hash for further reference (in uint256 format)    | 9 = (error) time period does not start immediately    | 8 = (error) time period didn't start as the previous ended    | 7 = (error) time period is higher than full vesting days    | 6 = (error) time period does not end on the full vesting day    | 5 = (error) allocation cycle does not equal 100%    | 4 = (error) allocation cycle has zero percentage    | 3 = (error) allocation cycles do not match    | 2 = (error) distribution table already exists    | 1 = (error) lengths of inputs do not match    | 0 = (error) not owner
returns.success: | true = set new distribution table    | false = error in distribution table

triggerCutoff(address).details: | Triggers the cutoff (reduction in allocation) for this recipient. This must be called by the address that has been specified previously to be the administrator for this recipient. If there are any tokens remaining from the distribution (total-cutoff) those are returned to the Shyft Core pool.      | The algorithm is: "remaining = (total - cutoff) - withdrawn", as long as "withdrawn" is lower than the newly cutoff allocation, otherwise it'll return how many tokens are over-allocated.

returns.distributionFound: if triggered, will return the remaining distribution
returns.result: | 3 = set the cutoff for this recipient, still has distribution    | 2 = set the cutoff for this recipient, was over already over-allocated    | 1 = cutoff already triggered    | 0 = not the cutoff admin address designated for this recipient

INITIAL_SUPPLY.details: The initial supply. Needs to be hardcoded for launch.

decimalFactor.details: The decimal factor for calculations (saves gas if it's pre-set here).

distributionHashToTableMapping.details: Mapping for keccak hash to distribution table.

kycContractRegistryAddress.details: The kyc contract registry address for erc20 token transfer mode.

shyftCoreTokenAddress.details: Address for the any of the cutoff tokens to be transferred to.

startTime.details: The start time for this distribution contract.

totalClaimed.details: The total amount of tokens claimed.

transferTokenMode.details: Whether this distribution contract is outputting to the Shyft KYC Contract token address.

claimTokens(address).notice: In any case where there has been an attempt to transfer tokens, this function will revert() if there is an error in the sending/claiming process.

userdoc.notice: |  This function should be disabled before launch, but for testing purposes there is a requirement to be able to receive native fuel, so this is done in the most strict mode possible, by checking ownership before value transfer can occur. |  receive() external payable { |      if (msg.sender != owner) { |          revert(); |      } |  } | | As such, the grunt setup file ('root'/Gruntfile.js) performs some operations to mirror this file to 'root'/Tests/ShyftKycDistribution_OutputForTestCompatibility.sol whenever any "test" related Grunt command is executed.
